revision.text:
{{Infobox settlement |official_name = Kvadraturen |other_name = |native_name = |nickname = |settlement_type = [[List of boroughs of Kristiansand|Borough]] of Kristiansand |image_skyline = {{Photomontage | photo1a = Kvadraturen-01.jpg{{!}}Kvadraturen | photo2a = Markens gate, Kristiansand.jpg{{!}} Ok | spacing = 2 | position = center | color_border = white | color = white | size = 266 | foot_montage = Descending, from top: Kvadraturen also known as downtown, bottom: [[Markens gate]] }} |image_shield = File:Kristiansand komm.svg |image_map = Kristiansand-borughs-kvadraturen.png |map_caption = Location of Kvadraturen, shown in yellow, in Kristiansand |subdivision_type = [[List of sovereign states|Country]] |subdivision_name = {{NOR}} |subdivision_type1 = [[List of regions of Norway|Region]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Southern Norway]] |subdivision_type2 = [[Counties of Norway|County]] |subdivision_name2 = [[Vest-Agder]] |subdivision_type3 = [[Districts of Norway|District]] |subdivision_name3 = [[Kristiansand Region|Kristiansand]] |subdivision_type4 = [[List of municipalities of Norway|Municipality]] |subdivision_name4 = [[Kristiansand]] |timezone1 = [[Central European Time|CET]] |utc_offset1 = +01:00 |timezone1_DST = [[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] |utc_offset1_DST = +02:00 |website = [http://www.kvadraturen.no/ kvadraturen.no]
[http://www.kristiansand.kommune.no/ kristiansand.kommune.no] |area_total_km2 = |population_as_of = 2015 |population_total = 6,750 |population_density_km2 = |postal_code_type = Post Code prefix |postal_code = 460*, 461* |coordinates = {{coord| 58.1468|07.9953|region:NO_type:city|display=inline,title}} |elevation_m = 7 |elevation_footnotes = {{cite web|title=Wergelandsparken, Kristiansand (Vest-Agder)|url=http://www.yr.no/place/Norway/Vest-Agder/Kristiansand/Wergelandsparken/|publisher=[[yr.no]]|accessdate=2017-02-19}}}} '''Kvadraturen''' is the city center of [[Kristiansand]] in [[Vest-Agder]] county, [[Norway]], with a population of 6,750 (2015). The borough is made up of the centre together with the harbour to the south and the more rural district of "[[Eg (Kristiansand)|Eg]]" to the north. Kvadraturen is the [[administrative centre]] of the municipality of Kristiansand as well as the administrative centre of [[Vest-Agder County Municipality|Vest-Agder county]], but is far smaller in area than the other boroughs in the municipality, such as the borough of [[Grim (Kristiansand)|Grim]] to the north and west, and the borough of [[Lund (Kristiansand)|Lund]] to the east. Kvadraturen is the location of the [[Kristiansand Cathedral]] and the nearby commercial, pedestrian street is [[Markens gate]]. The city harbour is located along the [[Kristiansandsfjorden]] and the island of [[Odderøya]]. The borough has three malls and three high schools. The closest public junior high is "Grim Skole" and the closest elementary is Tordenskjoldsgate Skole and is the only remanding elementary in Kvadraturen. The [[Sørlandet Hospital Kristiansand]] is also located in the borough, in the district of Eg. The main city centre was established as a city on 5 July 1641 by [[King Christian IV]]. The city became a self-governing municipality under the [[formannskapsdistrikt]] law on 1 January 1838. On 1 July 1921, a neighboring part of the municipality of [[Oddernes (municipality)|Oddernes]] (population: 2,164) was transferred from Oddernes to the city of Kristiansand. During the 1960s, there were many municipal mergers across Norway due to the work of the [[Schei Committee]]. On 1 January 1965, the city of Kristiansand (population: 27,100) was merged with the neighboring municipalities of [[Randesund (municipality)|Randesund]] (population: 1,672), [[Oddernes (municipality)|Oddernes]] (population: 18,668), and [[Tveit (municipality)|Tveit]] (population: 2,802) to form a new, larger municipality of Kristiansand.{{cite web|first=Dag|last=Jukvam|publisher=[[Statistics Norway|Statistisk sentralbyrå]]|title=Historisk oversikt over endringer i kommune- og fylkesinndelingen|year=1999|url=http://www.ssb.no/emner/00/90/rapp_9913/rapp_9913.pdf|language=Norwegian}} ==Shopping== [[Markens gate]] is the main pedestrian street in Kristiansand. It is one of Norway's most walked street and is over {{convert|2,778|ft|m|abbr=off|sp=us}} long. The street has many different stores. The walking zone stretches over seven blocks. During the 1600-1700s, the street was called Dronningens gate, and today its also nicknamed Stripen (The Strip). The most central part of the city is lower Markens where it meets Tollbodgata. Some stores here are open 24/7 and it is here most crimes of downtown Kristiansand take place. Chain restaurants like [[7-Eleven]], [[McDonald's]], and [[Deli de Luca]] are also located there. There are three malls at Kvadraturen: Sandens is the largest and newest one, Slottet Shopping is located at the north end of Markens gate in the north. Lille Markens is the smallest mall.{{cite web|url=https://www.kvadraturen.no/ |title=Kvadraturen |publisher=kvadraturen.no|date= |accessdate=2017-02-21}}{{cite web|url=https://www.visitnorway.com/listings/shopping-in-kristiansand-centre/86899/ |title=Shopping in Kristiansand Centre |publisher=visitnorway.com|date= |accessdate=2017-02-21}} ==Transportation== [[Kristiansand Bus Terminal]], [[Kristiansand Station]], and Kristiansand Harbor are all located at [[Vestre Strandgate]] next to each other.{{cite web|url=https://www.akt.no/|title=AKT|publisher=akt.no |date= |accessdate=2017-02-21}} Local buses goes from Henrik Wergelandsgate and [[Tollbodgata]]. Kristiansand Station has daily trains to [[Oslo S|Oslo]] and [[Stavanger Station|Stavanger]].{{cite web|url=https://www.nsb.no/ |title=NSB |publisher=nsb.no |date= |accessdate=2017-02-21}} Kristiansand Harbor has many daily ferry routes to [[Hirtshals]], [[Denmark]]. [[Kristiansand Airport, Kjevik]] is located {{convert|16|km}} from the city center, and it has routes to the biggest cities in Norway, with less frequent routes to other Northern European cities. ==Education== There are two public and one private high schools and one elementary school in the borough of Kvadraturen. The elementary school has students from over 27 different nationalities. The closest junior high schools are in the nearby boroughs of [[Grim, Kristiansand|Grim]] and [[Lund, Kristiansand|Lund]].{{cite web |title=VI Hjelper deg på Nett |url=https://www.minskole.no/ |publisher=minskole.no |date= |accessdate=2017-02-21}} {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ List of schools in Kvadraturen |- ! Name !! Location !! Type {{cite web|url=http://www.minskole.no|title = MinSkole}} |- | [[Kvadraturen skolesenter]] || Tollbodgata || [[High School]] |- | Noroff videregående skole || Elvegata || High School |- | [[Tangen High School]] || Tangen || High School |- | Tordenskjoldsgate skole || Nybyen || Elementary |} ==Politics== The 10 largest politics parties in Kvadraturen (2015): {| class="wikitable" style="center;" |colspan="2" | '''Kristiansand city council votes from Kvadraturen 2015'''{{cite web|url=http://www.vg.no/valgnatt/valg/kommune/fylker/vest-agder/kommuner/kristiansand/kretser/kvadraturen/|title= VG - Valgnatt|accessdate=14 September 2015|publisher=vg.no|language=Norwegian}} |- |[[Norwegian Labour Party|Labour Party]] || 28,3% (596 votes) |- |[[Conservative Party (Norway)|Conservative Party]] || 25,3% (532 votes) |- |[[Christian Democratic Party]] || 8,4% (177 votes) |- |[[Progress Party (Norway)|Progress Party]] || 7,4% (155 votes) |- |[[Green Party (Norway)|Green Party]] || 6,6% (138 votes) |- |[[Liberal Party (Norway)|Liberal Party]] || 5,9% (124 votes) |- |[[Socialist Left Party (Norway)|Socialist Left Party]] || 4,5% (95 votes) |- |[[The Democrats (Norway)|The Democrats]] || 4% (84 votes) |- |[[Pensioners' Party (Norway)|Pensioners' Party]] || 3,9%% (83 votes) |- |[[Red Party (Norway)|Red]] || 3,7% (78 votes) |- |[[Centre Party (Norway)|Centre]] || 1,1% (23 votes) |- |Others || 1,4% (29 votes) |- |'''Total''' ||''' 2124 votes''' |} ==Tourism== The borough of Kvadraturen is the site of many tourist attractions. [[Christiansholm Fortress]] was built in 1672. The Kilden Theatre, the largest culture house and theatre in Southern Norway, is located on the island of [[Odderøya]]. It was finished in 2012 and has a capacity of over 2,000. [[Fiskebrygga, Kristiansand|Fiskebrygga]] (The Fish Wharf), a former fish landing in Kvadraturen with Odderøya, has been redeveloped as a restaurant, shopping, and tourist destination.{{cite web|url=https://www.visitnorway.com|title=Visit Norway |publisher=VisitNorway.com |accessdate=2017-02-21}} ==Neighbourhoods== [[File:Kongens gate, Kristiansand.jpg|thumb|Kvadraturen sørøst]] *[[Baneheia]] *Byskogen *[[Bystranda]] *[[Eg (Kristiansand)|Eg]] *[[Fiskebrygga, Kristiansand|Fiskebrygga]] *Kvadraturen nordvest *Kvadraturen nordøst *Kvadraturen sørvest *Kvadraturen sørøst *[[Lagmannsholmen]] *Nybyen *[[Odderøya]] *[[Posebyen]] *[[Strandpromenaden, Kristiansand|Strandpromenaden]] *[[Tangen (Kristiansand)|Tangen]] ==Media gallery== Aquarama-Bystranda.jpg|Aquarama Kristiansand to Kvadraturen Kristiansand City Hall 01.jpg|[[Kristiansand City Hall]] Rådhuset i kristiansand.jpg|Kristiansand City Hall Kongens gate, Kristiansand1.jpg|Kongens gate (Kings street) revision.comment: [[Wikipedia:Bots/Requests for approval/PrimeBOT 29|Task 29]] - removal of deprecated parameters from [[Template:infobox person]] (+ genfixes)
revision.text:
{{Infobox person |name = Lutz W. Aengevelt |image = Dr.LutzAengevelt.jpg |caption = '''Lutz Aengevelt''' with his brother & partner '''Wulff Aengevelt''' in [[Düsseldorf]], [[Germany]] (2009) |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1943|06|04}} |birth_place = [[Offenbach am Main|Offenbach]], [[Germany]] |nationality = German |Degree = [[Economics Doctorate]] |occupation = [[Businessman]]
[[Real Estate]]
[[Chairman]], at
[[Aengevelt]] |Marital Status = Married |children = 2 |website = http://www.Aengevelt.com/ }} '''Dr. Lutz W. Aengevelt'''http://www.aengevelt.com/historie2.html{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} (born June 4, 1943) is a [[Germans|German]] businessman http://www.amazingdusseldorf.com/business-marketplace/corporate/real-estate/aengevelt.html who is the co-managing partner of '''Aengevelt Immobilien''' headquartered in [[Düsseldorf]], [[Germany]].http://ir.refire-online.com/upload/xyz/Invitation_and_Event_Programme.pdf Aengevelt is listed among the largest private [[real estate]] firms in [[Germany]]. Lutz Aengevelt along with his brother Wulff make up the third generation of the [[family business]].{{cite web|url=http://www.aengevelt.com/index.php?view=presse_detail&noseo=1&year=2003&mnp=37&pid=56&presse_search=|title=Immobilienmakler für Gewerbe, Investoren & Privatkunden - AENGEVELT|website=www.aengevelt.com|accessdate=24 October 2017}} ==Background Information== Dr. Lutz W. Aengevelt, married and father of two children, was born on 4 June 1943 in [[Offenbach am Main|Offenbach]]. In 1966, after he has finished his PhD in [[Economic]] [[Sciences]] he entered the real estate company founded by his grandfather Leo Aengevelt in [[Düsseldorf]] in the year 1910.{{Cite web |url=http://www.prestelandpartner.com/eventspeakers.html# |title=Archived copy |access-date=2012-06-09 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120429183929/http://www.prestelandpartner.com/eventspeakers.html# |archive-date=2012-04-29 |dead-url=yes |df= }} Since 1969 he has been managing partner of Aengevelt Immobilien GmbH & Co. kg. He is responsible for the departments of "[[Commercial letting]]", "[[Investment]]", "Placement of undeveloped land", "[[Project development]] / preparation and management", "[[Land recycling]]", "[[Real estate]] research" and "International real estate".{{cite web |url=http://www.aengevelt.com/unternehmen2.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-06-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121120031526/http://www.aengevelt.com/unternehmen2.html |archivedate=2012-11-20 |df= }} His theme, in addition to independence from foreign control, his social commitment and the training of qualified young talents: "A property is always part of a [[value chain]], we fully activate their potential." {{cite web |url=http://www.aengevelt.com/presse/detail/2003/dr.-lutz-aengevelt-wird-60--ndash--ein-zwischen-r--sume.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-06-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130116085445/http://www.aengevelt.com/presse/detail/2003/dr.-lutz-aengevelt-wird-60--ndash--ein-zwischen-r--sume.html |archivedate=2013-01-16 |df= }} Together with his brother Wulff, Dr. Lutz Aengevelt drives since the late 80's consistently the national and international expansion of the company's progress. He is the initiator and co-founder of the German broker association "DIP - German Real Estate Partners"5, founded in 1988, and the network "IPP - International Property Partners",{{cite web |url=http://www.ipp-global.com/markets.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-06-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120421021102/http://www.ipp-global.com/markets.html |archivedate=2012-04-21 |df= }} which offers customers real estate services throughout [[Europe]].{{cite web |url=http://www.dip-immobilien.de/1-1-Home.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-06-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120902002331/http://www.dip-immobilien.de/1-1-Home.html |archivedate=2012-09-02 |df= }} Additionally, Dr. Lutz Aengevelt became involved in diverse fields of [[real estate]] research and [[education]]. This counts as his assistance in research projects of the "Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft", the "German Institute for Urbanisitik" DIFU7, various ministries of the [[Federal Republic of Germany]], the federal states North Rhine-Westphalia, Rhineland Palatinate and [[Berlin]] on such topics as "Construction Law", "[[Industrial development]]", "[[Pollution]] Management" and "[[Real Estate]] [[Marketing]]".http://www.cimmit.de/index.asp?page=2011referenten&lang=deutsch&sid= There are also lectures and specialist presentations at diverse universities e.g. at the University of [[Applied Sciences]] and Arts HAWK8, and specialized conferences like the real estate conference CIMMIT 20119, [[Frankfurt]], or the Family Office Forum 201210, [[Wiesbaden]]. Beyond that, Dr. Lutz Aengevelt performs numerous volunteer activities, such as the advisory board of [[Deutsche Bank]] AG in [[Düsseldorf]],https://geschaeftsbericht.deutsche-bank.de/2003/gb/serviceseiten/downloads/files/loacm_25-03-04.pdf of the Stadtsparkasse [[Düsseldorf]] https://www.sskduesseldorf.de/pdf/downloads/Ventura_2011-1.pdf?IFLBSERVERID=IF@@031@@IF and of the Munich Trade Fair "EXPO REAL". He also was a longtime member of the General Assembly of the [[Düsseldorf]] Chamber of Commerce. In Düsseldorf,{{cite web |url=http://rm.hawk-hhg.de/holzminden/157552_175083.php |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-06-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130211031810/http://rm.hawk-hhg.de/holzminden/157552_175083.php |archivedate=2013-02-11 |df= }} he was also involved as the first chairman of the "support association monument Rochuskirche e.V.",http://www.der-immobilienbrief.de/uploads/tx_thpdfarchive/73.pdf, which aims the redevelopment and embodiment of the Rochus Church was and which was dissolved after 12 years of successful fulfillment of this task in 2002. Similarly varied as his professional and community involvement is also the private sector: The family is center of life. In addition, Dr. Lutz Aengevelt is an enthusiastic sportsman (including [[water sports]], [[association football|football]], [[hockey]], [[skiing]]), and Theaterfan and - how could it be otherwise - even in his limited free time interested in [[urban planning]]. == Aengevelt Immobilien == According to the [[Real Estate]] Finance Intelligence Report Europe (REFIRE) in 2010 Aengevelt was ranked first place ahead of [[Engel & Völkers]] and BW [[Baden]]-Württembergische [[Bank]] and were listed for having the highest level of client support and [[wikt:consultation|consultation]].http://ir.refire-online.com/upload/xyz/REFIRE-Report80.pdf In 2009 at the International Commercial Property Exposition (EXPO REAL) Immo [[News]] quoted Dr. Lutz Aengevelt stated the headline; "More decision makers, more front line visitors." in reference to the improved market and [[real estate]] environment.{{cite web |url=http://www.immo-news.net/EXPO-REAL-2009-Fewer-Participants-More-Intensive-Discussions-Higher-Quality_a6713.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-03-03 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120301115949/http://www.immo-news.net/EXPO-REAL-2009-Fewer-Participants-More-Intensive-Discussions-Higher-Quality_a6713.html |archivedate=2012-03-01 |df= }} ==Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung== In 2009 Lutz Aengevelt was interviewed by [[Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung]] and was posed the following questions; " Is the competition among [[brokers]] during this difficult time actually just down to the [[price]]?" {{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/1.827867|title=Lutz und Wulff Aengevelt: "Wir reden den Markt nicht schön"|first=Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung|last=GmbH|date=7 August 2009|website=FAZ.NET|accessdate=24 October 2017}} "Of course, competition is hard boned, but that does not take place on the commission rates, but on the evidence of achievement. One should also not overlook the fact that part of the competition is no longer there. Some have withdrawn from the sample transaction business, it is now known as the [[Asset Management]] and others are [[insolvent]]." - then going on to reiterate the fact that Aengevelt Immobilien has zero debt which is a pivotal aspect of their success and solidified infrastructure.{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/|title=SPIEGEL ONLINE - Aktuelle Nachrichten|first=Jakob|last=Augstein|publisher=|accessdate=24 October 2017|via=Spiegel Online}} == References == {{Reflist|2}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Aengevelt, Lutz}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1943 births]] [[Category:German businesspeople]]

revision.comment: add authority control, test
revision.text:
'''Marc de Garidel''' is a [[France|French]] businessman.<ref name="businessweek">{{Cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=169456&privcapId=135238|title=Marc M.P. de Garidel: Executive Profile & Biography|last=<!--Staff, no byline provided-->|first=|date=<!--dynamic and updated without date stamps-->|work=|agency=Bloomberg|access-date=4 November 2016|via=}}</ref> He serves as the non-executive chairman of the pharmaceutical company [[Ipsen]] and advises Mayroy, the Ipsen controlling holding company.<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="David Meek appointed as Chief Executive Officer of Ipsen">{{Cite web|url=http://www.ipsen.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/11-07-2016-PR-David-Meek-new-CEO-of-Ipsen.pdf|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160923020741/http://www.ipsen.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/11-07-2016-PR-David-Meek-new-CEO-of-Ipsen.pdf|archive-date=2016-09-23|title=(David Meek new CEO of Ipsen)|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref><ref name="ipsenbio">{{Cite web|url=http://www.ipsen.com/en/degaridel?height=420&width=420|title=Ipsen biography|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|access-date=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130411043326/http://www.ipsen.com/en/degaridel?height=420&width=420|archivedate=2013-04-11|df=}}</ref><ref name="promethera">{{Cite web|url=http://www.promethera.com/en/management/11/2|title=Management|last=<!--staff, no byline provided-->|first=|date=<!--not specified-->|website=|publisher=Promethera Biosciences|at=Board of Directors & and (sic) founders|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141011050159/http://www.promethera.com/en/management/11/2|archive-date=11 October 2014<!--present in versions back to Feb 2010; not present in next version of Feb 2015-->|dead-url=yes<!--present version of page does not contain supporting information-->|access-date=}}</ref><ref name="sante">{{Cite web|url=http://g5.asso.fr/qui-sommes-nous/les-membres-du-g5-sante/|title=Les membres du G5 santé|last=<!--no byline-->|first=|date=<!--no date provided-->|website=|publisher=G5 Health|language=French|trans-title=The G5 Health<!--Google Translate-->|access-date=}}</ref>
==Biography== ===Early life=== Marc de Garidel graduated from the [[École Spéciale des Travaux Publics]], an engineering [[grandes écoles]] in [[Paris]].<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="ipsenbio"/><ref name="promethera"/> He received business degrees from the [[Thunderbird School of Global Management]] in [[Glendale, Arizona]] and the [[Harvard Business School]].<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="ipsenbio"/><ref name="promethera"/>
===Career=== In 1983, he started his career at [[Eli Lilly and Company]], where he worked in France, the United States and [[Germany]].<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="ipsenbio"/>
In 1995, he joined [[Amgen]] as Vice President, of Finance and Treasury for Europe.<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="ipsenbio"/><ref name="promethera"/> In 1998, he became Vice President, Corporate Controller and Chief Accounting Officer of Amgen.<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="ipsenbio"/> In 2000, he became Vice President and General Manager for France, in charge of Amgen France.<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="ipsenbio"/> In 2006, he became Vice President for Southwestern Europe, including France, [[Spain]], [[Belgium]] and [[Portugal]].<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="ipsenbio"/> From 2007 to 2010, he served as Vice President for Southern Europe, the Middle East, Asia and Latin America at Amgen.<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="ipsenbio"/><ref name="promethera"/>
He has served as Chairman and CEO of Ipsen since November 2010.<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="ipsenbio"/><ref name="promethera"/><ref name="sante"/> He sits on the Board of Directors of [[TcLand Expression]].<ref name="businessweek"/> He is also Chairman of the Board of Promethera Biosciences and European Biopharmaceutical Entreprises.<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="promethera"/>
He is President and spokesperson for G5 santé, a lobbying group for French pharmaceutical companies, including [[BioMérieux]], [[Guerbet]], Ipsen, the Laboratoire français du Fractionnement et des Biotechnologies, [[Laboratoires Pierre Fabre]], [[Sanofi]], [[Stallergenes]] and Laboratoires Théa.<ref name="sante"/>
The Board of Directors of Ipsen has appointed [[David Meek]] as Chief Executive Officer, effective July 18, 2016.<ref name="David Meek appointed as Chief Executive Officer of Ipsen">[http://www.ipsen.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/11-07-2016-PR-David-Meek-new-CEO-of-Ipsen.pdf]</ref> On this date, Marc de Garidel will assume the role of non-executive chairman and will continue to serve the Board of Directors through his deep industry expertise. In addition, Marc de Garidel will advise Mayroy, the Ipsen controlling holding company.<ref>{{Cite press release|title=David Meek appointed as Chief Executive Officer of Ipsen|date=11 July 2016|publisher=Ipsen|url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20160710005032/en/David-Meek-appointed-Chief-Executive-Officer-Ipsen|via=Business Wire}}</ref>
He is a Knight in the National Order of the [[Legion of Honour]].
==Bibliography== *''La Société du Médicament'' (2006)
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Garibel, Marc de}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:French businesspeople]] [[Category:Eli Lilly and Company people]] [[Category:Amgen]] [[Category:Chevaliers of the Légion d'honneur]]

{{Infobox musical artist | name =Mark Chung | image = Mark Chung.jpg | alt = | caption = | image_size = | background =non_vocal_instrumentalist | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date ={{Birth date and age|1957|06|03}} | origin =[[Leeds]], [[England]] | instrument = | genre = | occupation =[[Musician]]
[[Music publisher (popular music)|music publisher]] | years_active =Late 1970s–present | label = | associated_acts =[[Abwärts]]
[[Einstürzende Neubauten]] | website =[http://www.freibank.com/ www.freibank.com] }} '''Mark Chung''' (born June 3, 1957, in [[Leeds]], [[England]][{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p64510|pure_url=yes}} Mark Chung] at [[Allmusic]]) is a German [[musician]] and music publisher, probably best known for his work as the bass guitarist of the German band [[Einstürzende Neubauten]]. ==Biography== From 1980 Chung was a member of the West German post-punk band [[Abwärts]] from [[Hamburg]] he joined [[Einstürzende Neubauten]] in 1981. He assumed responsibility for business management of the band until leaving in 1994 to concentrate on his work in the music industry. He formed [[Freibank]] Music Publishing in 1986, initially for controlling and administering the copyrights of Einstürzende Neubauten, but Freibank also offered this service to other musicians and steadily grew.[http://www.last.fm/music/Einst%C3%BCrzende+Neubauten Einstürzende Neubauten profile] at [[last.fm]] In 1996, Chung moved to [[London]], where he became senior vice-president of [[Sony Music International]]. After 9 years with Sony Music, he moved back to Germany and now directs the Freibank office in [[Berlin]]. In 2006, Chung was elected chairman of the German association of independent music companies (''Verband unabhängiger Musikunternehmen - VUT'') and he also sits on the board of the public-private partnership [[Initiative Musik]]. He is married and has two sons and a daughter. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.freibank.com/ Freibank Music Publishing] - official web site * {{Discogs artist|artist=Marc Chung}} {{Einstürzende Neubauten}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chung, Mark}} [[Category:1957 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:German bass guitarists]] [[Category:Male bass guitarists]] [[Category:Einstürzende Neubauten members]] [[Category:Musicians from Leeds]] [[Category:German businesspeople]] {{Germany-guitarist-stub}} {{Bass-guitarist-stub}}

page.title: Master of Science in Human Resource Development

revision.comment: /* Institutions with MS HRD Degree Programs */
revision.text:
A '''Master of Science in Human Resource Development''' (abbreviated ''HRD'' or ''MSHRD'') is a type of [[Postgraduate education|postgraduate academic]] [[master's degree]] awarded by universities in many countries. This degree is typically studied for in [[Human Resource Development]] and [[Human Resource Management]]. The key concepts include strategic human resource management, creatively studying and solving organisational problems and creating strategic alignment between human resource and organisational goals.<ref>https://www.uowdubai.ac.ae/master-of-business-human-resource-management</ref>
==Curriculum Structure== The Master of Science in Human Resource Development is a one to three years [[Master Degree]], depending on the program, some may even start with two-year preparation classes and covers various areas of human resource development.
Topics of study may include:
* [[business transformation]] * [[Competence (human resources)]] * [[Competency-based management]] * [[Corporate Culture]] * [[corporate social responsibilities]] * [[Employment relations]] * [[Employer branding]] * [[Employee engagement]] * [[human resource policies]] * [[Human resource management system]] * [[Human resource management in public administration]] * [[Industrial relations]] * [[Labor mobility]] * [[Organizational behavior and human resources]] * [[organizational culture]] * [[performance appraisal]] * [[Recruitment Process Outsourcing]] * [[succession planning]] * [[Strategic human resource planning]] * [[training and development]] * [[workplace diversity]]
==Institutions with MS HRD Degree Programs== Institutions in the United States that have a Masters of Science in Human Resource Development Degree Program include: *[[Clemson University]]<ref>http://www.grad.clemson.edu/programs/Human-Resources-Development/</ref> *[[New York University]]<ref>http://www.scps.nyu.edu/areas-of-study/leadership/graduate-programs/ms-human-resource-management/</ref> *[[Villanova University]]<ref>{{cite web|title=Masters in Human Resources|url=http://www.villanovau.com/hr-masters-degree/|publisher=[[Villanova University|Villanova]]}}</ref> *[[Xavier University]]<ref>http://www.xavier.edu/hrd/</ref> *[[University of Houston]]http://www.uh.edu/ *[[Florida International University]]<ref>https://lps.fiu.edu/academics/degrees-and-programs/MS-Adult-Edu-Human-Res-Dev/</ref>
== See also == * [[List of master's degrees]] * [[List of human resource management associations]] * [[Chief human resources officer]] * [[Human Resource Consulting]] * [[Human Resource Development Council]] * [[Professional in Human Resources]] * [[Society for Human Resource Management]]
==References== <references/>
{{Academic degrees}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Master Of Science In Human Resource Development}}

revision.text:
{{Other people|Michael O'Leary}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Michael O'Leary | image = Michael O’Leary 2015 (cropped).jpg | caption = O’Leary in 2015 at the [[World Economic Forum]] | birth_name = Michael Kevin O'Leary{{cite news|title=People: Ryanair Holdings PLC (RYAAY.O) – O'Leary, Michael|url=https://www.reuters.com/finance/stocks/officerProfile?symbol=RYAAY.O&officerId=174199|publisher=Reuters.com}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1961|03|20|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Kanturk]], [[County Cork]], [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]]{{disputed inline|date=July 2017}} | death_date = | residence = [[Delvin]], [[County Westmeath|Westmeath]], Ireland | nationality = [[Irish people|Irish]] | known_for = [[Chief Executive Officer]] of [[Ryanair]] | education = [[Clongowes Wood College]] | alma_mater = [[Trinity College, Dublin]] | occupation = Businessman | networth = US$1.03 billion (April 2018)https://www.forbes.com/profile/michael-oleary/ | spouse = {{marriage|Anita Farrell |6th September 2003}} | children = 4 | parents = Ted and Ger O'Leary | signature = | website = }} '''Michael Kevin O'Leary''' (born 20 March 1961) is an Irish businessman and the Chief Executive Officer of [[Ryanair]]. He is one of Ireland's wealthiest businessmen.{{cite news| url=http://business.timesonline.co.uk/tol/business/specials/rich_list/|title=Rich list | work=The Times | location=London | accessdate=2010-05-12}} ==Early life== Michael O'Leary was born 20 March 1961, the second in a family of six, in [[Kanturk]] in [[County Cork]].{{cite web|url=http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=48721542211 |title=Information on "Facebook" |publisher=Facebook.com |date=20 March 1961 |accessdate=2011-09-29}}{{disputed inline|date=July 2017}} He was educated at [[Clongowes Wood College]], [[County Kildare]]. In 1979, he began a four-year Bachelor in Economic and Social Studies programme at [[Trinity College, Dublin]]. He graduated from Trinity in 1983 and then worked as a trainee with Stokes Kennedy Crowley (later known as [[KPMG]]), studying the Irish tax system. He left after two years in 1985, setting up profitable newsagents in [[Walkinstown]] and [[Terenure]], Dublin. While at Stokes Kennedy Crowley, O'Leary had met [[Tony Ryan]], head of [[Guinness Peat Aviation]], a leasing company (GPA). Ryan was one of KPMG's clients and O'Leary advised Ryan on his personal income tax affairs. In 1987, Ryan hired O'Leary as his personal financial and tax advisor, where Ryan's main interest was in GPA. [[Ryanair]] was established around this time and originally followed a traditional business model, but quickly began to lose money. Subsequently O'Leary was sent to the USA to study the novel [[Southwest Airlines]] business model. {{citation needed|date=April 2015}} ==Ryanair career== Under O'Leary's management, Ryanair further developed the [[low-cost carrier|low-cost model]] originated by [[Southwest Airlines]].{{cite news|author=Matthew Maier, Business 2.0 Magazine staff writer |url=http://money.cnn.com/magazines/business2/business2_archive/2006/04/01/8372814/index.htm |title=A radical Fix for Airlines: Make Flying Free, '''Forbes''', 1 April 2006 |publisher=Money.cnn.com |date=31 March 2006 |accessdate=2011-09-29}} O'Leary may have described the inauguration of the ancillary revenue movement during a 2001 interview in ''[[The Sunday Times]]''."Flying for Free on Ryanair", 13 May 2001, BBC News "The other airlines are asking how they can put up fares. We are asking how we could get rid of them." The business model envisioned by O'Leary uses receipts from on board shopping, internet gaming, car hire and hotel bookings to replace the ticket revenue from selling airline seats. Savings are also made by negotiating discounts with airports for reduced landing fees. In many cases, regional airports have made no charges so as to secure flights that bring passengers and wealth into their area. The deregulation of Ireland's major airports and a transformation of traditional full-service airlines are among his demands.RTÉ radio 10 February 2007, in "Conversations with Eamon Dunphy"[http://www.irishpost.co.uk/news/story.asp?j=5286&cat=news Irish Post: Ryanair chief hints of possible departure] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928014654/http://www.irishpost.co.uk/news/story.asp?j=5286&cat=news |date=28 September 2007 }} In August 2014, O'Leary unveiled plans to develop a ''Ryanair [[Israel]]'' to operate extensive flights to and from Israel and a large network of European cities. The plans include the establishment of a large hub in Israel.{{cite news|title=Israeli market beckons Ryanair|url=http://www.irishsun.com/index.php/sid/225083355|date=25 August 2014|accessdate=25 August 2014|publisher=''Irish Sun.com''}} ==Controversy and reputation== O'Leary has a reputation for loose talk in the airline industry and among its regulators. Many press articles have often described him as arrogant, and prone to making comments which he later contradicts.{{cite web|author=ZEIT ONLINE GmbH, Hamburg, Germany |url=http://www.zeit.de/2004/29/Monti-Amt?page=4 |title=Die Festung wankt: Europas mächtige Wettbewerbshüter verurteilen Microsoft und stoppen Fusionen. Geschwächt von Pannen, geraten sie jetzt in den Machtkampf um die Besetzung der EU-Kommission. Eine Innenansicht Von Arne Storn | ZEIT online |publisher=Zeit.de |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}}{{cite web|url=http://www.epolitix.com/EN/ForumBriefs/200702/94382ad2-5e35-449a-a96c-efed15704d95.htm|title=Breaking politics and political news for Westminster and the UK - PoliticsHome.com|work=epolitix.com}}{{cite web|author=Auteur: Helena WILMET |url=http://www.nieuwsblad.be/Article/Detail.aspx?articleID=grufctss |title=Het Nieuwsblad – Ryanair-topman Michael O'Leary schudde luchtvaartwereld wakker |publisher=Nieuwsblad.be |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}}[http://www.gqmagazine.co.uk/Daily_News/default.aspx?related=high%20flying British GQ 10 Things To Know Today] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927221134/http://www.gqmagazine.co.uk/Daily_News/default.aspx?related=high%20flying |date=27 September 2007 }}{{cite web|url=http://archives.tcm.ie/businesspost/2003/07/06/story813091014.asp |title=Ryanair's anti-Ahern campaign gets the thumbs-down from PR industry: ThePost.ie |publisher=Archives.tcm.ie |date=6 July 2003 |accessdate=2011-09-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101008044155/http://archives.tcm.ie/businesspost/2003/07/06/story813091014.asp |archivedate=8 October 2010 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.rvu.nl/archief/nep/2003/stuntvliegers.pdf |title=NTR | Home |publisher=Rvu.nl |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}} He has been extravagantly outspoken in his public statements, sometimes resorting to personal attacks and foul language.{{cite news|author=Family fun |url=http://www.independent.ie/national-news/iron-mike-fires-last-round-at-warweary--taoiseach-1341289.html |title=Iron Mike fires last round at war-weary Taoiseach – National News, Frontpage |publisher=Independent.ie |date= 8 April 2008|accessdate=2011-09-29}}{{cite news| url=http://business.guardian.co.uk/story/0,,1513268,00.html | work=The Guardian | location=London | title=The Guardian profile: Michael O'Leary | first=Andrew | last=Clark | date=24 June 2005 | accessdate=2010-05-12}}{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/airlines/story/0,,1888915,00.html | work=The Guardian | location=London | title=Michael O'Leary: Stunt pilot whose enemies would love to see him crash | date=6 October 2006 | accessdate=2010-05-12 | first=Hans | last=Kundnani}}{{cite news| url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/life_and_style/article676356.ece | work=The Times | location=London | title=When I stuff BA Ill quit | date=20 June 2006 | accessdate=2010-05-12 | first=Anushka | last=Asthana}}{{cite web|url=http://www.boeing.com/news/frontiers/archive/2003/february/i_qa.html |title=Boeing Frontiers Online |publisher=Boeing.com |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}}{{cite news| url=http://www.economist.com/books/displaystory.cfm?story_id=9681074 | work=The Economist | title=Snarling all the way to the bank | date=23 August 2007}}{{cite news|author=How to wear: |url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/taking-the-flight-fight-to-ryanair-1232610.html |title=Taking the flight fight to Ryanair – Irish, Business |publisher=Independent.ie |date= 29 November 2007|accessdate=2011-09-29}}{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/2008/feb/04/ryanair.theairlineindustry | work=The Guardian | location=London | title=Ryanair warns high oil prices could slash its profits by 50% next year | first=Fiona | last=Walsh | date=4 February 2008 | accessdate=2010-05-12}} His abrasive management style, ruthless pursuit of cost-cutting and his explicitly hostile attitude towards corporate competitors, airport authorities, governments, unions and customers has become a hallmark.{{cite web|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/local-national/war-in-irish-skies-as-regional-rival-claims-ryan-air-boss-oleary-told-him-f-f-13927366.html |title=War in Irish skies |publisher=Belfasttelegraph.co.uk |date=4 August 2008 |accessdate=2011-09-29}} He was reported to have been aggressive and hostile in dealings with a woman who was awarded free flights for life in 1988.“Woman claims [[Ryanair]] reneged on free travel prize”, 28 February 2002, at [http://www.rte.ie/news/2002/0228/ryanair.html RTE Business]; last accessed 18 December 2006.{{cite news| url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/ryanair-ordered-to-pay-damages-for-reneging-on-free-flights-offer-to-millionth-customer-180852.html | work=The Independent | location=London | title=Ryanair ordered to pay damages for reneging on 'free flights' offer to millionth customer | first=Mark | last=Sage | date=20 June 2002 | accessdate=2010-05-12}} In 2007, he was forced to retract a claim that Ryanair had cut emissions of carbon dioxide by half over the previous five years; the claim should have been that emissions 'per passenger' had been cut by half.“Ryanair retracts emissions claim”, 29 January 2007, at [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/6310571.stm news.bbc.co.uk]; last accessed 19 March 2010. O'Leary has been reported to have impersonated a journalist in an attempt to find information passed on to a newspaper following a safety incident on a Ryanair flight.{{cite web|last=Duggan |first=Barry |url=http://www.unison.ie/irish_independent/stories.php3?ca=9&si=498833&issue_id=5125 |title=Ryanair staff were menacing: passenger – National News, Frontpage – Independent.ie |publisher=Unison.ie |date=18 November 2010 |accessdate=2011-09-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160108154700/http://www.unison.ie/irish_independent/stories.php3?ca=9&si=498833&issue_id=5125 |archivedate=8 January 2016 |df= }} On occasion he has apologised for personal attacks under threat of legal action.{{cite news|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/ireland/2010/0508/1224269952195.html |title=Sat, May 08, 2010 – O'Leary in court apology to union official |publisher=The Irish Times |date=5 May 2010 |accessdate=2011-09-29}} He has been criticized by a judge for lying, who said he was lucky not to be found guilty of contempt of court.{{cite news|url=http://www.rte.ie/news/2010/0326/ryanair.html |title=Judge criticises Michael O'Leary for lying – RTÉ News |publisher=RTÉ.ie |date=26 March 2010 |accessdate=2011-09-29}} In April 2017, he called concerns about climate change "complete nonsense".See: [https://fd.nl/ondernemen/1196165/topman-ryanair-zorg-over-klimaatverandering-is-complete-onzin?s_cid=671 Topman Ryanair: Zorg over klimaatverandering is 'complete onzin'], Financieel Dagblad (a Dutch financial newspaper), 10 April 2017. Accessed on 10 April 2017. In a press conference discussing Ryanair's planned intercontinental service [[RyanAtlantic]], O'Leary jokingly described the airline's planned business class travel experience as featuring "whores and rum".{{cite web|url=http://www.liveleak.com/view?i=b5e_1214473286 |title=Free Oral Sex to Business Class Customers on Ryanair says CEO |publisher=LiveLeak.com |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}} In 2002 he said that his company is against any long-haul transatlantic services, stating that:
The low-cost model only really works for short-haul flights [...] If we started flying farther afield, we'd have to do something stupid like introducing what I call a 'rich class' to make it pay.{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/travel/723867/Eindhoven-haven't-you-always-wanted-to-go.html | work=The Daily Telegraph | location=London | title=Eindhoven: haven't you always wanted to go? | first=Adrian | last=Bridge | date=2 April 2002 | accessdate=2010-05-12}}
However, more than a decade later, in 2013 he said, while at the [[Paris Air Show]], that he wanted to sell cheap flights from the U.S. to Europe for as low as 10 euros ($13) or $10, if conditions were right. He said that he needed a fleet of at least 30 twin-aisle aircraft and access to ports (e.g. major U.S. and European cities, in the airline industry there are so called slots or sometimes gates, often regulated by law, and without obtaining them it is impossible to have regular service to airports). Despite his claims in 2002, there were so called budget airliners in the past – for example [[Laker Airways]] flights from London to New York in the late 1970s or long-hauls at budget-fares on other continents like AirAsiaX in Malaysia and the Australian Jetstar Group.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/ryanair-wants-launch-flights-between-us-europe-aims-jump-growth-rate-will-return-13-billion-1315549|title=Ryanair Wants To Launch Flights Between US And Europe, Aims For Jump In Growth Rate And Will Return $1.3 Billion To Shareholders: CEO Michael O’Leary|author=Nat Rudarakanchana|date=20 June 2013|work=International Business Times}} Reacting to the decision to close European airspace in April 2010 over worries about the [[Volcanic ash|ash]] plume from [[2010 eruptions of Eyjafjallajökull|an erupting Icelandic volcano]] he said "there was no ash cloud. It was mythical. It's become evident the airspace closure was completely unnecessary." One study concluded that serious structural damage to aircraft could have occurred if passenger planes had continued to fly.{{cite news |first=Steve |last=Connor |url=http://www.independent.ie/opinion/analysis/steve-connor-airspace-closure-due-to-ash-cloud-fears-was-right-move-2629069.html |title=Steve Connor: Airspace closure due to ash cloud fears 'was right move' – Analysis, Opinion |publisher=Independent.ie |date= 26 April 2011|accessdate=2011-09-29}} Scientists and the industry as a whole remain unconvinced, however.{{fact|date=July 2017}} In May 2014 O'Leary was highly critical of a 24-hour strike by [[Aer Lingus]] [[Flight attendant|cabin crew]], staged on 30 May 2014. Aer Lingus, whose biggest shareholder at the time was O'Leary's company Ryanair, had to cancel 200 flights and disrupt travel plans for 200,000 people. O'Leary accused Aer Lingus of "mismanagement" of its employee relations, called for the sacking of a board member, and said the striking employees should be punished by having their discount travel incentives withdrawn for a year.{{cite news|title=Striking Aer Lingus cabin crew should be punished says airline shareholder|url=http://www.irishsun.com/index.php/sid/222467203/scat/aba4168066a10b8d/ht/Striking-Aer-Lingus-cabin-crew-should-be-punished-says-airline-shareholder|accessdate=31 May 2014|publisher=Irish Sun.com}} According to the [[Bilderberg Group]],{{cite web|url=http://bilderbergmeetings.org/participants2015.html|title=Participants - Bilderberg Meetings|work=bilderbergmeetings.org}} O'Leary was to attend the [[Bilderberg Group]] in 2015.{{cite news|title=Secretive in Telfs-Buchen, Austria 11-14 in June this year|url=http://bilderbergmeetings.org/meeting_2015.html|work=bilderbergmeetings.org/}}{{cite web|title=Ryanair chief asked to join select conference reputed to truly govern international affairs|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/news/world/secretive-bilderberg-group-sets-sights-on-michael-o-leary-1.2119343|date=27 February 2015|accessdate=27 February 2015|first=Arthur|last=Beesley|publisher=The Irish Times}} O'Leary was also seen attending the 2017 Bilderberg meeting in Washington D.C. ===Registration of private car as taxi=== {{main article|O'Leary Cabs}} [[File:Michael-olearys-taxi-oleary-cabs-mg99-mercedes.jpg|thumb|Michael O'Leary's personal [[Mercedes-Benz W220|Mercedes-Benz S500]], operated by '''[[O'Leary Cabs]]''' and complete with "for hire" roof bar]] In 2004 he purchased a [[taxi cab|taxi]] plate for his [[Mercedes-Benz S-Class]], to enable it to be classified as a [[taxicab|taxi]] so that he could legally make use of [[Dublin]]'s [[bus lane]]s to speed up his car journeys around the city. A press report suggested that since he had stopped driving his own taxi, he has employed a driver with full PSV licence. In 2005 the Irish transport minister expressed concern at this abuse by O'Leary and others.{{cite web|last=Henderson |first=Deric |url=http://www.unison.ie/irish_independent/index.php3?issue_id=8841 |title=News Ireland | Irish News Paper | Free News Stories Online from The Irish Independent Newspaper – Independent.ie |publisher=Unison.ie |date=18 November 2010 |accessdate=2011-09-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150501125339/http://www.unison.ie/irish_independent/index.php3?issue_id=8841 |archivedate=1 May 2015 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.taxi.ie/oleary-taxi.shtml# |title=Ireland Taxi Ireland Hackney cab Irish Taxi chauffeur transport |publisher=Taxi.ie |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}} ==Personal life== O'Leary lives in Gigginstown House near [[Delvin]] in [[County Westmeath]]. He married Anita Farrell in September 2003, and they have four children.{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/woman/celeb-news/michael-oleary-i-dont-understand-the-point-of-holidays-26623322.html|work=Irish Independent|title=Michael O'Leary: 'I don't understand the point of holidays'|date=16 January 2010|accessdate=12 May 2013}} He breeds [[Aberdeen Angus cattle]] and horses at his [[Gigginstown House Stud]]{{cite web |url=http://www.sportingchronicle.com/goldcup.html 2006 |title= Cheltenham Gold Cup, 16 March 2006}} in County Westmeath. In 2006, his horses [[War Of Attrition (horse)|War of Attrition]] and in 2016 [[Don Cossack (horse)|Don Cossack]] have won the [[Cheltenham Gold Cup]]{{cite news | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/5265260.stm |title=Profile: Michael O'Leary |author=Simon Calder |accessdate=4 June 2009 | work=BBC News | date=18 August 2006}} and the [[2016 Grand National]] with [[Rule The World (horse)|Rule The World]]. He also won in the [[2018 Grand National]] with [[Tiger Roll]]. O'Leary has also been a [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] [[Manchester City F.C. supporters|supporter]] since an early age. In 2003, he was offered the opportunity to buy a stake in the club but believed the potential benefits did not outweigh the risk and preferred to visit England to watch a few matches each season.{{Cite web |title=Ryanair snubs €25m Man Utd shirt deal offer |url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/ryanair-snubs-25m-man-utd-shirt-deal-offer-26782581.html |work=independent.ie |date=16 October 2011 |accessdate=2017-09-29}} He notably wore a Manchester City shirt when unveiling Ryanair's new destinations to and from Manchester Airport in 2011.{{Cite news |title=Ryanair chief Michael O'Leary announces 26 routes from Manchester Airport which could create up to 2,000 jobs |url=http://menmedia.co.uk/manchestereveningnews/news/business/s/1426482_ryanair-chief-michael-oleary-announces-26-routes-from-manchester-airport-which-could-create-up-to-2000-jobs |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=12 July 2011 |accessdate=12 July 2011}} In February 2015 he revealed in an interview in ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' that he was offered and turned down, for family reasons, the starring role in ''[[The Apprentice (UK TV series)|The Apprentice]]'' reality game show before it was offered to and accepted by [[Alan Sugar]].{{cite news| url= http://www.evoke.ie/showbiz/michael-oleary-apprentice-star-rejection/|work=evoke.ie | title= Big softie! Michael O’Leary turned down starring role in Apprentice for his kids and horses| date= 24 February 2015}} ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== {{commons category|Michael O'Leary (businessman)}} {{Sister project links}} * [[Fortune magazine]] name Michael O'Leary as the [https://web.archive.org/web/20040415021654/http://www.fortune.com/fortune/information/Presscenter/0%2C%2C12242001europe%2C00.html European Businessman of the Year] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Oleary, Michael}} [[Category:1961 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People educated at Clongowes Wood College]] [[Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Dublin]] [[Category:20th-century Irish people]] [[Category:21st-century Irish people]] [[Category:Irish businesspeople]] [[Category:Irish chief executives]] [[Category:Chief executives in the airline industry]] [[Category:Ryanair]] [[Category:Irish accountants]] [[Category:People from County Westmeath]]

revision.comment: [[User:AnomieBOT/docs/TemplateSubster|Substing templates]]: {{Incomplete}}. See [[User:AnomieBOT/docs/TemplateSubster]] for info.
+2017–18 Belgian football fraud investigation
revision.text:
[[File:Mogi_Bayat_-_Sporting_Charleroi.JPG|thumb|Mogi Bayat in 2005]] '''Mogi Bayat''' ([[Tehran|Teheran]], June 24, 1974), official name '''Arnaud Bayat'''<ref name="arnaud">[http://www.dhnet.be/sports/football/division1/charleroi/qui-est-vraiment-mehdi-bayat-51b74f46e4b0de6db978b7f3 Qui est vraiment Mehdi Bayat?], ''[[La Dernière Heure]]'' (3 oktober 2012), geraadpleegd op 11 februari 2015.</ref>, is an [[Iran|Iranian]]-[[France|French]] businessman. He was Managing Director of the football club [[R. Charleroi S.C.|Sporting Charleroi]] from 2003 till 2010. He is the cousin of [[Abbas Bayat]] and the brother of [[Mehdi Bayat]].<ref name="rijkstebelgen">[http://derijkstebelgen.be/nieuws/voetbalgeld-mogi-bayat-makelaar-50-miljoen-euro Mogi Bayat, de makelaar van 50 miljoen euro], derijkstebelgen.be (3 september 2018)</ref>
== Biography == The Iran-born Mogi Bayat moved to the United States when he was 6 years old, where he was getting treatment.<ref>[http://archives.lesoir.be/-aujourd-8217-hui-tout-est-possible-a-charleroi-_t-20101009-0137RC.html "Aujourd’hui, tout est possible à Charleroi"], ''[[Le Soir]]'' (9 oktober 2010).</ref> One year later, he and his family moved to France.
Bayat became a businessman and became the director of the fruit juice brand Sunnyland France. He stopped with this in 2003 when he was appointed as managing director of football club [[R. Charleroi S.C.|Sporting Charleroi]].
Since December 2010 Bayat became active as a player broker. He had influence on the transfers of [[Anthony Limbombe]], [[Kaveh Rezaei]], [[Obbi Oularé|Obbi Oulare]], [[Łukasz Teodorczyk|Lukasz Teodorczyk]], [[Massimo Bruno]], [[Adrien Trebel]], [[Samuel Kalu]], [[Bubacarr Sanneh]], [[Thomas Foket]] and other players.
On 10 October 2018 Bayat was arrested. He was suspected of money laundering and matchfixing.<ref>[http://sporza.be/nl/matches/voetbal/2018-10/liveblog-gerechtelijk-onderzoek-bij-topclubs-jupiler-pro-league/ Gerechtelijk onderzoek bij topclubs Jupiler Pro League], [[Sporza]] (10 oktober 2018)</ref>
==See also== *[[2017–18 Belgian football fraud investigation]]
== References == {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bayat, Mogi}} [[Category:living people]] [[Category:1974 births]] [[Category:French businesspeople]] [[Category:Iranian businesspeople]] [[Category:Association football executives]]

revision.comment: +hat
revision.text:
{{for|the Swedish actor and singer|Nils Ericson (actor)}} {{Infobox engineer |image = Nils Ericson, Nordisk familjebok.png |image_size = |alt = |caption = Late portrait of Nils Ericson,
painted by [[Uno Troili]]. |name = ''Friherre'' Nils Ericson |nationality = Swedish |citizenship = |birth_date = {{birth date|1802|1|31|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Långbanshyttan]], [[Värmland]], Sweden |death_date = {{death date and age|1870|9|8|1802|1|31|df=y}} |death_place = [[Stockholm]], Sweden |education = |spouse = |parents = Olof and Brita Sophia (Yugstrom) Ericsson |children = Werner Ericson |discipline = Canal and railway engineer. |institutions = [[Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences]] |practice_name = |employer = |significant_projects = |significant_design = |significant_advance = |significant_awards = |signature = }} [[Image:Stockholm Centrals staty 2006l.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Statue of Nils Ericson in front of [[Stockholm Central Station]]]] '''''Friherre'' Nils Ericson''' (31 January 1802 – 8 September 1870) was a [[Sweden|Swedish]] [[mechanics|mechanical]] [[engineer]] (as was his younger brother [[John Ericsson]], who emigrated to England and then the USA). He became a prominent Swedish canal and railway builder. Born Nils Ericsson, he was raised to the untitled nobility by king [[Oscar I of Sweden]] in 1854, and with this he reverted to a spelling of his surname with only one "s". In 1859 he was made a [[Freiherr#Swedish title|Friherre]] (equivalent to English [[Baron]]), the 403rd such elevation to Sweden's titled nobility. ==Background== John and Nils were born in [[Långbanshyttan]], [[Värmland]], Sweden and received no formal education, but were taught the rudiments of mechanics from an early age by their father, Olof Ericsson.{{sfn|Church|1890|p=17}} Olof worked as the superintendent of a [[mining|mine]] in Värmland until he lost money in speculations and had to move his family to [[Forsvik]], [[Västergötland]], in 1810. There Olaf became a director of blastings during the excavation of Sweden's [[Göta Canal]] (built 1810-1832). He secured permission for his sons to draw in the office of the draughtsmen of the canal company, where they also learned to draw maps, and he persuaded Lieutenant Brandenburg of the Navy Mechanical Corps to teach them the art of shading and 'finishing off' mechanical drawings before they were in their teens.{{sfn|Church|1890|p=15}} Their extraordinary skills were noted by [[Baltzar von Platen (1766-1829)|Baltzar von Platen]], the architect of the Göta Canal, and they were soon dubbed cadets of mechanics of the [[Swedish Navy]] and engaged as trainees at the canal enterprise. When two engineers sent to England by Count Platen to obtain information about canal construction returned in 1815 and began to instruct a number of cadets of the Swedish Corps of Mechanical Engineers, the Ericsson brothers were among them; Nils being then twelve years old and John eleven.{{sfn|Church|1890|p=18}} ==Career== In 1823 Nils Ericson joined the Engineering corps of the [[Swedish Army]] as a second lieutenant, but in 1830 he transferred to the Navy Mechanical Corps (where he eventually advanced to the rank of colonel in 1850). In 1833 he married a daughter of Count von Schwerin in [[Östergötland]]. Between 1830 and 1850 Nils Ericson planned and directed the construction of the canals at Stallbacka, [[Säffle]], [[Karlstad]] and Albrektsund. He also led the construction of the [[Saimaa Canal]] in [[Finland]] (constructed 1845-52), the reconstruction of the [[Trollhätte Canal]] in [[Trollhättan Municipality]] and the [[floodgate]] at [[Stockholm]]. In 1845, he was elected a member of the [[Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences]]. After 1850 he was primarily occupied with the design and construction of the Swedish state-owned railway system. At the same time he led the planning of the [[Dalsland Canal]] while construction there was being led by his son Werner. Sweden started building railways later than many other European countries, having hesitated under heavy debate for several years because of the costs and other issues. Following the [[Parliament of Sweden|Riksdag]]'s decision in 1854, Erikson was chosen to lead the project of building the main lines (stambanorna). There was also a decision that, for military reasons, the railways should avoid the coasts as much as possible. His proposal was that the line between Gothenburg and Stockholm ([[Western Main Line]], ''Västra stambanan'') should run south of Lake [[Mälaren]] to avoid competition with shipping. He also proposed that the line between [[Malmö]] and Stockholm ([[Southern Main Line]], ''Södra stambanan'') should go north via Nässjö to meet up with Western Main Line at [[Falköping]] until the Western's eastward construction reached [[Katrineholm]], where a better junction could be built with a southern line heading directly to Nässjö. This line was called Eastern Main Line (''Östra stambanan'') but has in modern times been defined to be part of the Southern Main Line. Ericson's proposal also included the railway between Stockholm and [[Ånge]] ([[Northern Main Line]], ''Norra stambanan'') and [[Main Line Through Upper Norrland]] (''Stambanan genom övre Norrland'') which runs between [[Bräcke]] and [[Boden, Sweden|Boden]]. A railway between [[Oslo]] and [[Laxå]] ([[Värmland Line|Northwestern Main Line]], ''Nordvästra stambanan'') was also planned, to connect with Western Main Line. The first parts of the Western and Southern lines were opened in 1856. Ericson resigned in 1862 when all of the Western line opened, and in 1864 the Southern line was opened in its entirety. Northwestern line was opened in 1871, Eastern line in 1874, Northern line in 1881 and the line through Upper Norrland in 1894. When Ericson resigned in 1862 his authority was divided between two agencies (the Building Bureau and the Traffic Bureau) until the formation of Kungliga Järnvägsstyrelsen (the Royal Railway Committee) in 1888. Ericson died in Stockholm in 1870, aged 68, and lies buried in Stockholm's Northern Cemetery ([[Norra begravningsplatsen]]). ==Monuments and memorials== *A bronze statue of Ericson stands on the forecourt outside [[Stockholm Central Station|Stockholm's central railway station]]. *The [[Nils Ericson Terminal]] bus station joined to the central railway station in [[Gothenburg]] is named after him. ==See also== *[[History of rail transport in Sweden]] *[[List of Swedish noble families]] ==Notes== {{reflist|colwidth=20em}} ==References== *{{cite book |last=Church |first=William Conant |title=the Life of John Ericsson, Vol.1 |year=1906 |origyear=1890 |publisher=C. Scribner's Sons |location=New York |id= |ref= |url=https://archive.org/details/lifeofjohnericss00churrich }} ==External links== *[http://www.bgf.nu/ljus/u/ericson.html Nils Ericson Biography] '''Swedish''' * Nils Ericson at [https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8887 Find-A-Grave] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ericsson, Nils}} [[Category:1802 births]] [[Category:1870 deaths]] [[Category:People from Filipstad Municipality]] [[Category:Swedish engineers]] [[Category:Swedish businesspeople]] [[Category:Swedish inventors]] [[Category:Swedish Army officers]] [[Category:Swedish nobility]] [[Category:Members of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences]] [[Category:Burials at Norra begravningsplatsen]]

revision.comment: /* References */ Removed [[Category:American pimps and madams]]
revision.text:
{{Notability|date=December 2017}} <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:PearlStarr.jpg|thumb|right|Pearl Starr (right) with two unidentified women]] --> '''Rosie Lee Reed''' (September 1868 – July 6, 1925), better known as '''Pearl Starr''', was an [[United States|American]] [[pimp|bordello owner]] and [[businesswoman]] in [[Arkansas]], the first child of [[Belle Starr]], the reputed "Bandit Queen" of the [[American Old West]], and Jim Reed, Belle's first husband.
==Early life== Pearl Starr was born in [[Rich Hill, Missouri|Rich Hill]], [[Missouri]]. As a small child, she moved often before her outlaw father died in a gunfight when she was six. Her mother then married a [[Cherokee]] named Sam Starr, and settled beside the [[Canadian River]] in the [[Indian Territory]] at a place called [[Younger's Bend]]. Starr was twenty-one when her mother, Belle Starr, was murdered.
Belle Starr claimed that Pearl was the daughter of the outlaw [[Cole Younger]]. While no official record exists, pictures of a young Pearl Starr show an uncanny resemblance to Cole Younger. Her parentage may always be in doubt.
Most historical writers accept that Starr gave birth to an illegitimate daughter named Flossie in April 1887, when she was 18. Belle Starr sent her daughter away to relatives to have her baby.
In 1888 Starr's brother, Edwin, was found in possession of stolen property and was shot by his accomplice. What became of Starr's daughter is unknown, but in the summer of 1888 Starr returned alone to her mother's house at Younger's Bend to care for her brother.
==Prostitution== Edwin's case went to trial in July 1889. He was found guilty and sent to prison. About this time Starr married Will Harrison, but the couple were divorced in 1891. Capitalizing on the [[dime novel]] fame of Belle, Pearl Reed changed her name to Pearl Starr at this time. She became a prostitute in [[Van Buren, Arkansas|Van Buren]], [[Arkansas]], ostensibly to make money for the purpose of getting her brother out of prison. She eventually put together a defense team that managed to secure a presidential pardon for Edwin in 1893.
Starr moved to [[Fort Smith, Arkansas]] and established her own [[bordello]]. Located on "the Row," Fort Smith's waterfront street of [[gambling]] halls, [[Bar (establishment)|saloons]] and bordellos, the house was identified with a bright red star surrounded by lighted pearls. The parlor featured a talented [[piano]] player, good [[whiskey]] and supposedly the "most beautiful girls west of the [[Mississippi River|Mississippi]]." Business prospered and Pearl purchased additional brothels, besides investing in saloons and other property.
Starr had another illegitimate daughter in 1894 and named her Ruth. Starr married Arthur Erbach in 1897 and had a son with him in 1898. Her new husband and son died of [[malaria]] within a year's time. Both are buried in the Oak Cemetery in Fort Smith. By 1902, she was living with Dell Andrews and though not married to him had another daughter, Jennette, in November.
The only time Starr was implicated in a crime was in 1911. After a burglary at a general merchandise store in Fort Smith, police found several stolen items hidden at Starr's Winslow home. She was found guilty of robbery and sentenced to a year in the [[Arkansas State Penitentiary]]. Posting $2000 bail, Starr's attorneys appealed the case to the [[Arkansas Supreme Court]], which overturned the verdict.
==Last years== In 1916 the city of Fort Smith began enacting ordinances making prostitution illegal. For some time, Starr's activities were overlooked, but she was eventually arrested. The charges were dropped on the understanding that Starr would leave the community. In 1921, at age 53, she left for [[Douglas, Arizona|Douglas]], [[Arizona]]. She died there on July 6, 1925 and was buried in Calvary Cemetery.
==Flossie Starr's account== Starr's daughter Flossie was credited with writing a two-part article for the ''[[Dallas Morning News]]'' Sunday editions on April 30 and May 7, 1933. According to these articles, Starr fully believed that her brother Edwin, always resentful of Belle's attention to Starr, was their mother's killer, but was never able to prove it.
==References== * Shirley, Glenn, Belle Starr and Her Times: The Literature, the Facts and the Legends. Norman: University of Oklahoma Press, 1982, {{ISBN|0-8061-2276-5}}.
{{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Starr, Pearl}} [[Category:1868 births]] [[Category:1925 deaths]] [[Category:People of the American Old West]] [[Category:American brothel owners and madams]] [[Category:American prostitutes]] [[Category:Hatfield family]] [[Category:People from Bates County, Missouri]] [[Category:People from Van Buren, Arkansas]] [[Category:People from Fort Smith, Arkansas]]

{{for|the conductor, educator and composer|Richard Franko Goldman}} {{Infobox person | name = Richard N. Goldman | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = April 16, 1920 | birth_place = | death_date = {{Death date and age|2010|11|29|1920|04|16}} | death_place = | nationality = [[United States|American]] | other_names = | known_for = Richard and Rhoda Goldman Fund | occupation = Businessman
Philanthropist | spouse = [[Rhoda Goldman]] | children = [[John D. Goldman]]
[[Douglas E. Goldman]]
Susan R. Gelman
Richard Goldman (deceased) | parents = Richard Samuel Goldman
Alice Wertheim Goldman }} '''Richard N. Goldman''' (April 16, 1920 – November 29, 2010) was an [[United States|American]] [[philanthropist]] who co-founded the [[Goldman Environmental Prize]] in 1990 with his wife, [[Rhoda Goldman]].{{cite news|first=Elizabeth|last=Weise|title=Founder of Goldman Environmental Prize dies |url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/sciencefair/post/2010/11/founder-of-goldman-environmental-prize-dies/1|work=[[USA Today]] |publisher=|date=2010-11-30 |accessdate=2010-11-30}} The ''[[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]]'' has called Goldman "one of the most influential [[Jewish]] philanthropists in the [[United States]]." {{cite news|first=|last=|title=Philanthropist Richard Goldman dies at 90|url=http://www.jta.org/2010/11/30/news-opinion/united-states/philanthropist-richard-goldman-dies-at-90|work=[[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]] |publisher=|date=2010-11-29 |accessdate=2010-11-30}} He founded the insurance company [[Goldman Insurance and Risk Management]], and with his wife he established the Richard and Rhoda Goldman Fund in 1951. ==Philanthropy== Richard and Rhoda Goldman established the Goldman Environmental Prize in [[San Francisco]], [[California]], in 1990. Goldman's foundation, which is sometimes nicknamed the "Green Nobel," awarded six prizes annually worth $150,000 USD to environmental activists representing six regions of the world. Approximately $13.2 million has been awarded to activists from more than 70 countries since the Goldmans established the award, as of 2010. The 1991 Goldman Environment Prize winner [[Wangari Maathai]] from Kenya and founder of the [[Green Belt Movement]], was awarded the [[Nobel Peace Prize]] in 2004.{{cite news |title=Richard Goldman, founder of the Goldman Prize, dies at age 90 |url=http://www.grist.org/article/2010-12-01-an-apprecation |first=Glenn |last=Hurowitz |date=1 December 2010 |journal= [[Grist (magazine)|Grist]]| accessdate=8 December 2010 }} In addition to his work with the Goldman Environmental Prize, Goldman supported [[beautification]] projects in San Francisco, and co-founded the Richard and Rhoda Goldman Fund. Through his foundation, which is worth more than one billion dollars, Goldman funded projects throughout the [[San Francisco Bay Area]], including the Jewish Community Center of San Francisco and the Rhoda Goldman Plaza. Among his California projects were investments in [[solar power]], and protection of [[redwood]] forests and sealife. In 2004, he was awarded the Chairman's Medal in the 11th Annual [[Heinz Award]].{{cite web | last = | first = | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = The Heinz Awards :: Richard Goldman | work = | publisher = Heinz Family Foundation | date = | url = http://www.heinzawards.net/recipients/richard-goldman | format = | doi = | accessdate = 2010-12-04}} The [[Goldman School of Public Policy|Richard and Rhoda Goldman School of Public Policy]] at [[UC Berkeley]] is named for the Goldmans.{{cite web| last =| first =| authorlink =| coauthors =| title =Goldman School of Public Policy - University of California, Berkeley| work =| publisher =| date =| url =http://gspp.berkeley.edu/index.html| doi =| accessdate =2011-04-22| deadurl =yes| archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20110703073549/http://gspp.berkeley.edu/index.html| archivedate =2011-07-03| df =}} ==Personal life== Richard Goldman was the son of lawyer Richard Samuel Goldman and his wife Alice Wertheim Goldman.{{cite news |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/science/environment/la-me-richard-goldman-20101201,0,4580734.story |title=Richard N. Goldman dies at 90; co-founder of Goldman Environmental Prize |first=Bettina |last=Boxall |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date= 1 December 2010 |accessdate=8 December 2010 }} He died at his home in [[San Francisco]] on November 29, 2010, at the age of 90. He was survived by his daughter, Susan Gelman, and two sons, John and [[Douglas E. Goldman|Doug]]. He was predeceased by his wife, philanthropist [[Rhoda Haas Goldman]], who died in 1996 and their son, Richard, who died in 1989.{{Cite web|last=Barnes |first= Bart |authorlink= |title=Richard W. Goldman Lawyer Richard W. Goldman, 42, a partner in the law firm of Hunton & Williams and a former assistant U.S. attorney in Washington, died Oct. 18 at George Washington University Hospital |publisher=[[Washington Post]]|date=October 20, 1989 |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1989/10/20/ed-bowman-dies-at-78/6fb6a2f1-90ac-475b-b9a7-a30c155ff278/ |accessdate=|quote=He also was a member of the Adas Israel Congregation...Survivors include his wife of 20 years, Susan Sachs Goldman; three children, Daniel Sachs Goldman, William Sachs Goldman and Alice Rebecca Goldman}}{{Cite web|last= |first= |authorlink= |title=Bill Goldman, 38, historian, philanthropist and Levi Strauss heir, killed in plane crash |publisher=[[Jewish Telegraph Agency]]|date=July 14, 2017 |url=https://www.jta.org/2017/07/14/news-opinion/united-states/bill-goldman-38-historian-philanthropist-and-levi-strauss-heir-killed-in-plane-crash |accessdate=}} A memorial service was held at [[Congregation Emanu-El (San Francisco)|Congregation Emanu-El]] in San Francisco. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.oac.cdlib.org/findaid/ark:/13030/hb0x0nb4gv/?query=Richard%2520N.%2520Goldman Finding Aid for the Richard N. and Rhoda H. Goldman papers, 1863-2003], [[The Bancroft Library]] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Goldman, Richard}} [[Category:1920 births]] [[Category:2010 deaths]] [[Category:American philanthropists]] [[Category:People from San Francisco]] [[Category:University of California, Berkeley alumni]] [[Category:Jewish American philanthropists]] [[Category:Haas family]]

{{Infobox Politician | image =<!-- only free-content images are allowed for depicting living people - see [[WP:NONFREE]] --> | imagesize = 150px | | honorific-prefix = [[The Honourable]] | name = Richard Melbourne Hurlburt | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1950|04|25}} | birth_place = [[Carleton, Nova Scotia]] | residence = [[Hebron, Nova Scotia]] | assembly = Nova Scotia House of | constituency_AM = [[Yarmouth (provincial electoral district)|Yarmouth]] | term_start = August 16, 1999 | term_end = February 9, 2010 | predecessor = [[John Deveau]] | successor = [[Zach Churchill]] | party = [[Progressive Conservative Association of Nova Scotia|Progressive Conservative]] | religion = | spouse= Nancy | occupation = construction contractor}}
'''Richard Melbourne Hurlburt''' (born April 25, 1950) is a [[Canadians|Canadian]] politician. He represented the electoral district of [[Yarmouth (provincial electoral district)|Yarmouth]] in the [[Nova Scotia House of Assembly]] from 1999 to 2010.
==Biography== In June 1999, he barely escaped with his life when his light plane crashed into a lake in Yarmouth County. He said he would have drowned if it had not been for a passenger who dragged him from the wreckage.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ngnews.ca/Business/2010-02-10/article-799022/QuickSketch-of-Nova-Scotia-Conservative-Richard-Hurlburt/1|title=QuickSketch of Nova Scotia Conservative Richard Hurlburt|publisher=The News|date=February 10, 2010|accessdate=September 20, 2014}}</ref>
Hurlburt was a Yarmouth County municipal councillor for 11 years and was warden of Yarmouth County for 5 years.
He was a member of the [[Progressive Conservative Association of Nova Scotia|Progressive Conservatives]]. Until the cabinet of Premier [[Darrell Dexter]] was sworn in on June 19, 2009, Hurlburt served as Minister of Service Nova Scotia and Municipal Relations.
===Expenses scandal=== Hurlburt resigned from the legislature on February 9, 2010, following [[Nova Scotia Parliamentary Expenses Scandal|revelations]] that he had spent his constituency allowance on a generator and a 40" television, which together cost over $11,000.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/hurlburt-resigns-amid-spending-flap-1.912084|title=Hurlburt resigns amid spending flap|publisher=CBC News|date=February 9, 2010|accessdate=September 20, 2014}}</ref> He sought sanctuary in Florida citing "severe depression" where he was visited by his son and his lawyer, Martin Pink.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.southcoasttoday.ca/content/news-archive|title=Hurlburt reported close to collapse in Florida|publisher=Shelburne County Today|date=February 18, 2010|accessdate=September 20, 2014}}</ref>
On February 14, 2011, it was announced that Hurlburt was among four people facing criminal charges in connection with the RCMP investigation into 2010s MLA expense scandal. Hurlburt was charged with fraud exceeding $5,000, breach of trust by a public officer, and 3 counts of uttering a forged document.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/mla-spending-probe-in-n-s-gets-4-charged-1.998239|title=MLA spending probe in N.S. gets 4 charged|publisher=CBC News|date=February 14, 2011|accessdate=September 20, 2014}}</ref>
On February 23, 2012, Hurlburt's lawyer said his client would plead guilty to fraud and breach of trust. In exchange, three charges of uttering forged documents were dropped.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ex-MLA Hurlburt will plead guilty over expense scandal|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/ex-mla-hurlburt-will-plead-guilty-over-expense-scandal-1.1221970|publisher=CBC News|accessdate=May 7, 2018|date=February 23, 2012}}</ref> On April 12, 2012, Hurlburt pleaded guilty to fraud and breach of trust.<ref>{{cite web|title=Hurlburt pleads guilty in N.S. spending scandal|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/hurlburt-pleads-guilty-in-n-s-spending-scandal-1.1187508|publisher=CBC News|accessdate=May 7, 2018|date=April 12, 2012}}</ref> On July 27, 2012, Hurlburt was sentenced to 12 months of house arrest, followed by 12 months of probation.<ref>{{cite web|title=Former N.S. cabinet minister gets house arrest|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/former-n-s-cabinet-minister-gets-house-arrest-1.1257996|publisher=CBC News|accessdate=May 7, 2018|date=July 27, 2012}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
{{Rodney MacDonald Ministry}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Hurlburt, Richard}} [[Category:1950 births]] [[Category:Canadian businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Members of the Executive Council of Nova Scotia]] [[Category:Nova Scotia municipal councillors]] [[Category:Progressive Conservative Association of Nova Scotia MLAs]] [[Category:People from Yarmouth County, Nova Scotia]] [[Category:21st-century Canadian politicians]]
